turns.content: This is Dorothy, who's this?
Hi Grandma, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm in a bit of trouble. Can you help please?
Oh hello there, dearie. I'm sorry but your voice isn't clear and I can't quite place who it is right now. Could you tell me your name again sweetie?

It's me, your grandchild! I got into a bit of trouble downtown and need some help getting out of this mess. Please, grandma, I'm in the county jail right now for a DUI arrest and I really need to get out but my phone is running low on battery. Can you come pick me up and bring 8500 dollars? It's urgent!

Oh dear, that sounds like quite a predicament. But let's not rush into anything. Could you give me your name again, dear? And maybe I could call one of the other children to confirm who this is before we do anything else? We don't want there to be any mix-ups, and it's important for me to get this right before I head out anywhere or spend money like that.

It's your grandson/granddaughter! Please, grandma, you have to trust me. This really is an emergency. Can you at least come with the cash if not now then tomorrow morning? It means a lot to me and I promise everything will be okay once I get out of here. Just need someone to vouch for me so they'll let me out on bail. Please, grandma...

I'm really sorry, dear, but this all sounds too sudden and serious. I think it's best if you have a family member who knows about your situation firsthand come by the house or call one of us back to confirm everything is okay. It would make me feel much better knowing everyone was on the same page before we decide how to handle things like this. Can you please get someone else in touch with me? I just want to be sure it's really an emergency and not some kind of mistake.

Okay, Grandma, I understand your concern. Please, can you at least give me a chance by coming over here tomorrow morning? I'll make sure everything is set up so that when you get here, they will let me out without any issues. Just this once, please help me get through this tough spot. It's really important to me and I know deep down you want to support your family in times like these.

I appreciate your understanding, dear. But it would be better if someone else could come and verify what's going on first. This is a lot to handle over the phone, especially with my hearing not being as good as it used to be. I really want to help but need to make sure everything is okay before I do anything drastic like this. Could you have another family member contact me so we can sort things out properly? Thank you for understanding, sweetie.

Please, Grandma, just give me a chance tomorrow morning. I'll be waiting here and all I need is your help to get through this. It's really important and I promise it won't happen again if you could just help me now. It means the world to me.

I'm worried about rushing into something without being fully sure, dear. Can we have someone else come by or call us back tomorrow morning to confirm everything? That way, everyone will be happier knowing all bases are covered. I hope you understand my need for caution here. Let's wait until then and see what happens.

Alright Grandma, okay. Just please come early in the morning. It'll all make sense when you get here. Trust me, this is a real emergency and your help will save me from a lot of trouble. Please be there tomorrow at 9 AM sharp. That's all I'm asking for now.

I appreciate your trust in me, dear, but I feel it's best to have someone else confirm everything first before we make plans to visit the jail. Can we agree that another family member will call or come by to verify tomorrow morning? This way, everyone feels safe and secure. Thank you for understanding, sweetie. Let's proceed carefully.

Okay Grandma, I'll ask someone to help us out tomorrow then. Please just make sure to be there at 9 AM. It means so much to me that you would come and help in this time of need. I know it's a lot but I really need your support right now. Thank you for considering my request.

I will do my best, dear, but let's have another family member confirm everything before we proceed with any plans. It's important to ensure that everyone is on the same page and understands what's happening. We'll make sure it all works out well tomorrow after verifying things first. Thank you for your understanding, sweetie.

Alright Grandma, let's do that then. Just please be there at 9 AM tomorrow so we can sort everything out properly. I really appreciate you working with me on this and I hope everything will work out just fine once everyone is in agreement. Talk to you soon, grandma. Love you.

I love you too, dear. Let's make sure everything is sorted out correctly before we take any big steps. Have a family member confirm things tomorrow morning, okay? That way, we can proceed with peace of mind. Take care and I'll talk to you soon.
Okay grandma, thank you so much for your understanding. Talk to you tomorrow then. Love you.
You're very welcome, dear. Talk to you tomorrow and stay safe. Love you too.
Bye grandma, see you tomorrow.
